author: cbs8
title: Judge orders changes in way Orleans inmates transferred
text:
NEW ORLEANS (AP) - A dilapidated holding area that was used when inmates were transferred from the New Orleans jail to court will have to be re-opened.
A federal judge issued the order Thursday amid complaints from local judges about the way inmates were being brought to court from a brand new jail nearby.
Judges have been complaining that inmates were being brought from the new jail in a manner that sometimes exposed them to witnesses and crime victims. U.S. District Judge Lance Africk told Sheriff Marlin Gusman to again use an area of the old jail known as "the docks" to hold court-bound inmates until a new arrangement can be made.
Africk told the city to cover the cost of bolstering security in the area.
Africk is overseeing court-ordered reforms at the jail.
